title: Police find young girl in home alongside man's dead body and seriously injured woman
text:
News Police find young girl in home alongside man's dead body and seriously injured woman The child is being looked after by relatives after the man was found dead and the woman was airlifted to hospital with "extensive injuries" Share The scene in Ashby, Leicestershire Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! A young girl was found inside a house alongside a man's dead body and a seriously injured woman. 
Police were called to the home in Ashby, Leicestershire, yesterday afternoon. 
A man's corpse was found in the building, as well as a woman with "extensive injuries" who was air-lifted to hospital. 
The child was unharmed and is being cared for by relatives. 
The house has been cordoned off for forensic tests. 
The cause of the man's death is not clear. 
A Leicestershire Police spokesman said: "The investigation is in its early stages, but at this point detectives are not looking for anyone else in connection with the enquiry. Police investigate outside the house (Photo: leicestermercury.co.uk) Officers are appealing for witnesses (Photo: leicestermercury.co.uk) Read More Couple arrested 'trying to kidnap premature baby from hospital may have struck on another ward just days earlier' 
"They have stressed that whilst the local community will be shocked by news of this incident, they should not be alarmed about their own personal safety." 
Graham Allman, a district councillor in the town, told the Leicester Mercury : "Obviously something tragic has happened and it's most unfortunate. 
"My thoughts and feelings go out to all those who are affected by this. The incident happened in Holland Crescent, Leicestershire (Photo: leicestermercury.co.uk) The location of the tragedy in Holland Crescent (Photo: leicestermercury.co.uk) Read More 
"I was in Ashby and I did hear a lot of sirens at about half past three. That's not unusual these days, unfortunately. 
"One of my staff told me she had heard something about a death in Ashby." 
Anyone with information about the incident at 3.20pm on Thursday in Holland Crescent is asked to call police on 101. Like us on Facebook
